title: The War Between The States & The Undefeated Southern Truth
description:
--This is my DVDrip of a VHSrip of this great doc--

The War Between The States And The Undefeated Southern Truth


Program Info:
The end of the documentary also the title: 
"The War Between The States And The Federal Government"

This is a rip from the .iso file that jamesers upped(cheers!) that can be found here: <a href="
http://tracker.conspiracycentral.net/torrents-details.php?id=3984&hit=1" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://tracker.conspiracycentral.net/torrents-details.php?id=3984&hit=1</a>

This video will give you a definitive understanding of America's most critical war. The contents of this video are designed to present the untold history of the planning and events that led to war. Topics covered include: slavery; how some blacks owned white slaves in Virginia; abolitionists, and how that movement was taken over for the purpose of pushing America into war; how the Constitution was the target and victim of the war. This video explains the European connection, and the foreign infiltration into the Confederate government itself; the tracing of a continuum of secession attempts dating back to 1804; the illegality of reconstruction and the creation of the 14th Amendment Citizenship hoax; and everything needed to trace the roots of today's power hungry Federal Government.

Interviews include: John Hurley, President of the Confederate Embassy in Washington D.C. speaks on Southern Culture. Eustice Mullens presents the evidence of the lesser known 'intrigues' that created the war. Randy Geiszler speaks on the legal ramifications of the war affecting the Constitution, Martial Law and the 13th and 14th Amendments. Professor Edward Smith covers the 'Black' issues of the war including the Northern slave industry as well as discussion of the Blacks who served in the Confederacy. Other issues covered are Secession, States Rights, Reconstruction, Carpetbaggers, the Dred Scott Decision, and much more, including biographical profiles of the Who's Who in this catalog of treason.

This video is spiced up with reenactment scenes on the battlefield and with titles and graphics that assist the viewer in getting the names and facts straight.  This is a one of a kind video documentary that covers the subjects avoided by the establishment."

Please don't complain about the quality...this is the best you'll get of a rare doc for free. And if you know what year this came out, say so, I'll add it to the info.
